==Events==
*[[202 BC]] &ndash; [[Second Punic War]]: At the [[Battle of Zama]], [[Roman Republic|Roman]] legions under [[Scipio Africanus]] defeat [[Hannibal Barca]], leader of the army defending [[Carthage]].
*[[439]] &ndash; The [[Vandals]], led by King [[Gaiseric]], take [[Carthage]] in [[North Africa]].
*[[1216]] &ndash; [[King John of England]] dies at [[Newark-on-Trent]] and is succeeded by his nine-year-old son [[Henry III of England|Henry]].
*[[1386]] &ndash; The [[Heidelberg University|Universität Heidelberg]] held its first lecture, making it the oldest German university.
*[[1466]] &ndash; The [[Thirteen Years' War (1454–66)|Thirteen Years' War]] ends with the [[Second Peace of Thorn (1466)|Second Treaty of Thorn]].
*[[1469]] &ndash; [[Ferdinand II of Aragon]] marries [[Isabella I of Castile]], a marriage that paves the way to the unification of [[Aragon]] and [[Crown of Castile|Castile]] into a single country, [[Spain]].
*[[1512]] &ndash; [[Martin Luther]] becomes a doctor of theology (''Doctor in Biblia'').
*[[1649]] &ndash; [[New Ross|New Ross town]], [[Co. Wexford]], [[Ireland]], surrenders to [[Oliver Cromwell]].
*[[1781]] &ndash; At [[siege of Yorktown|Yorktown, Virginia]], representatives of [[Kingdom of Great Britain|British]] commander [[Charles Cornwallis, 1st Marquess Cornwallis|Lord Cornwallis]] handed over Cornwallis' sword and formally surrendered to [[George Washington]] and the [[Jean-Baptiste Donatien de Vimeur, comte de Rochambeau|comte de Rochambeau]].
*[[1789]] &ndash; Chief Justice [[John Jay]] is sworn in as the first [[Chief Justice of the United States]].
*[[1805]] &ndash; Napoleonic Wars:  Austrian [[Karl Freiherr Mack von Leiberich|General Mack]] surrenders his army to the [[Grand Army]] of [[Napoleon]] at the [[Battle of Ulm]]. 30,000 prisoners are captured and 10,000 casualties inflicted on the losers.
*[[1812]] &ndash; [[Napoleon I of France]] retreats from [[Moscow]].
*[[1813]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Leipzig]] concludes, giving [[Napoleon I of France|Napoleon Bonaparte]] one of his worst defeats.
*[[1822]] &ndash; In [[Parnaíba]]; Simplício Dias da Silva, João Cândido de Deus e Silva and Domingos Dias declare the independent state of [[Piauí]].
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[Battle of Cedar Creek]] &ndash; [[Union Army]] under [[Philip Sheridan]] destroys a Confederate Army under [[Jubal Anderson Early|Jubal Early]].
*  1864   &ndash; [[St. Albans Raid]] &ndash; [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] raiders launch an attack on [[Saint Albans, Vermont]] from [[Canada]].
*[[1866]] &ndash; [[Venice]] - Annexion of [[Veneto]] and [[Mantua]] to Italy - At Hotel Europa, [[Austria]] hands over Veneto to [[France]], which hands it immediately over to [[Italy]].
*[[1900]] &ndash; [[Max Planck]], in his house at [[Grunewald]], on the outskirts of [[Berlin]], discovers the law of [[black body]] emission ([[Planck's law]]).
*[[1904]] &ndash; [[Polytechnic University of the Philippines]] founded as Manila Business School through the superintendence of the [[United States|American]] C.A. O'Reilley.
*[[1912]] &ndash; [[Italy]] takes possession of [[Tripoli]], [[Libya]] from the [[Ottoman Empire]].
*[[1914]] &ndash; The [[First Battle of Ypres]] begins.
*[[1917]] &ndash; The [[Dallas Love Field|Love Field]] in [[Dallas, Texas]] is opened.
*[[1921]] &ndash; Portuguese Prime Minister [[António Granjo]] and other politicians are murdered in a [[Lisbon]] [[Bloody Night|coup]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; British [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative]] [[Member of Parliament|MPs]] meeting at the [[Carlton Club meeting|Carlton Club]] vote to break off the [[Lloyd George ministry|Coalition Government]] with [[David Lloyd George]] of the [[Liberal Party (UK)|Liberal Party]]. 
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[Germany]] withdraws from the [[League of Nations]].
*[[1935]] &ndash; The [[League of Nations]] places economic sanctions on [[Kingdom of Italy (1861–1946)|fascist Italy]] for its invasion of [[Ethiopia]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[Streptomycin]], the first [[antibiotic]] remedy for [[tuberculosis]], is isolated by researchers at [[Rutgers University]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[United States]] forces land in the [[Philippines]].
*[[1950]] &ndash; The [[People's Liberation Army]] takes control of the town of [[Qamdo]]; this is sometimes called the [[Invasion of Tibet (1950)|"Invasion of Tibet"]].
*  1950   &ndash; The People's Republic of China joins the [[Korean War]] by sending thousands of troops across the [[Yalu river]] to fight [[United Nations]] forces.
*  1950   &ndash; [[Iran]] becomes the first country to accept technical assistance from the United States under the [[Point Four Program]].
*[[1954]] &ndash; First ascent of [[Cho Oyu]].
*[[1956]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Union]] and [[Japan]] sign a [[Soviet–Japanese Joint Declaration of 1956|Joint Declaration]], officially ending the state of war between the two countries that had existed since August 1945.
*[[1969]] &ndash; The first [[Prime Minister of Tunisia]] in [[1957|twelve years]], Bahi Ladgham, is appointed by President [[Habib Bourguiba]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; President [[Richard Nixon]] rejects an Appeals Court decision that he turn over the [[Watergate tapes]].
*[[1974]] &ndash; [[Niue Constitution Act 1974 (NZ)|Niue]] becomes a self-governing colony of New Zealand.
*[[1976]] &ndash; [[Battle of Aishiya]] in [[Lebanon]].
*[[1986]] &ndash; [[Samora Machel]], President of [[Mozambique]] and a prominent leader of [[FRELIMO]], and 33 others die when their [[Tupolev 134]] plane [[1986 Mozambican Tupolev Tu-134 crash|crashes]] into the [[Lebombo Mountains]].
*1986 &ndash; The [[Boston Red Sox]] win Game 2 of the [[1986 World Series]] versus the [[New York Mets]] 9-3 at [[Shea Stadium]].
*[[1987]] &ndash; The [[United States Navy]] conducts [[Operation Nimble Archer]], an attack on two [[Iran]]ian oil platforms in the [[Persian Gulf]].
*  1987   &ndash; [[Black Monday (1987)|Black Monday]] - the [[Dow Jones Industrial Average]] falls by 22%, 508 points.
*[[1988]] &ndash; The [[Government of the United Kingdom|British government]] imposes a [[1988–94 British broadcasting voice restrictions|broadcasting ban]] on television and radio interviews with members of [[Sinn Féin]] and eleven [[Irish republicanism|Irish republican]] and [[Ulster loyalism|Ulster loyalist]] paramilitary groups.
*[[1989]] &ndash; The convictions of the [[Guildford Four]] are quashed by the [[Court of Appeal of England and Wales]], after they had spent 15 years in prison.
*[[2001]] &ndash; [[SIEV-X]], an [[Indonesia]]n fishing boat en route to [[Christmas Island]], carrying over 400 [[asylum seekers]], sinks in international waters with the loss of 353 people.
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[Mother Teresa]] is [[Beatification|beatified]] by [[Pope John Paul II]].
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[Care International]] aid worker [[Margaret Hassan]] is kidnapped in [[Iraq]].
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[Saddam Hussein]] [[Trial of Saddam Hussein|goes on trial]] in Baghdad for [[crimes against humanity]].
*  2005   &ndash; [[Hurricane Wilma]] becomes the most intense Atlantic hurricane on record with a minimum pressure of 882 mb.
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[Philippines]]: A bomb explosion rocked Glorietta 2, a shopping mall in [[Makati]]. The blast killed 11 and injured more than 100 people.
*[[2012]] &ndash; [[Big Tex]], a 52-foot statue and cultural icon in [[Dallas]], [[Texas]], is destroyed by fire during the final weekend of the 2012 [[State Fair of Texas]].
*[[2013]] &ndash; At least 105 people have been injured in a [[2013 Buenos Aires train crash|train crash]] at the [[Once railway station]] in [[Buenos Aires]].
